sponsor.partnerMessage: Oyster is your partner in global employment for an increasingly global workforce. Over 1,000 companies are hiring, paying, and taking care of their team members all over the world with Oyster’s all-in-one global employment platform. Start building your team HERE

posts.title: NWA Tax Revenue Jumps 8.66% Signaling Strong Start For 2023
posts.content:
February's reports revealed that Bentonville, Fayetteville, Rogers, and Springdale brought in a collective $10.052m in sales tax revenue, showing growth in the face of persistent inflation and higher prices.

  • A good start: Despite a 0.44% decline in Rogers, the cities are up 8.66% over last year collectively, with Bentonville seeing the most significant increase at 22.17%.
  • Great off the blocks: City leaders expect consumer spending to slow as inflation persists, but a solid start to the year puts most on track for the yearly budget.

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: Slip Into Something Different at Lady Slipper in Downtown Bentonville
posts.content:
Last week we were able to visit the highly anticipated Lady Slipper in Downtown Bentonville, and it thoroughly exceeded our expectations.

  • Come and find me: A speakeasy lounge and restaurant situated in the basement of Bentonville’s historic Massey building, its unassuming location invites you to find it for yourself.
  • Stay a while: Once underground, you're exposed to a tasteful selection of drinks, food, and art. Some of our favorites were the meat and cheese board and their namesake Smash Burger, all chased down with one of their signature cocktails.

For some date night or after-work happy hour ideas, you should check out their IG HERE.

posts.title: ASBTDC Offering March Training Sessions For Startups
posts.content:
The Arkansas Small Business and Technology Development Center (ASBTDC) is offering several sessions in March to help small businesses start or grow their dream ventures. 

  • Business Basics: ASBTDC provides free and affordable one-on-one consulting, online classes, and in-person workshops for entrepreneurs and business owners on financial analysis, market research, loan packaging, marketing, profitability, and more.
  • Online and local: Several online options range topics from Retaining Employees Through Benefits to How to Win At Social Media, and a few of the workshops coming to NWA include Beginner SEO for Small Business Owners, Marketing Boot Camp, and Financial Boot Camp.

Find these free training opportunities and more HERE.

posts.title: Listening Forest Reopens Tonight At Crystal Bridges
posts.photoCredit: Crystal Bridges Museum of American Art
posts.content:
The interactive Listening Forest returns tonight to light up the forest around the art museum until the end of May, and that's just one of several engaging exhibits currently on display at Crystal Bridges.

  • Reliving Rivera: Uncover the social and cultural life of Mexico and America in Diego Rivera's America, the first major exhibition focused exclusively on Mexican artist Diego Rivera in over 20 years. 
  • Portraits: Explore American identities, human relationships, and current events through one of the 20th and 21st century's most celebrated photographers Annie Leibovitz.

See Crystal Bridges' full 2023 exhibition lineup HERE.

posts.title: Bike Rack Brewing Co Hosts Ozark Innovators Networking Happy Hour
posts.content:
Connect with other local entrepreneurs during Startup Junkie's Ozark Innovators Networking Happy Hour this evening, Mar 1, in Bentonville. 

  • Craft libations and ideations: The Happy Hour will last from 5:30p to 7:30p at Bike Rack Brewing's Taproom in 8th Street Market. 
  • Make connections: The event is co-sponsored by BorderCode, a talent recruiter connecting European developers with American startups, and Innoflexion, a leading Silicon Valley software services, and product engineering company. 

Reserve your spot HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Future Triple Threats: TheatreSquared's Spring Break Musical Theatre Camp helps get kids out of the house and onto a stage. In this skills-based camp, students 7-13 years of age are trained in the foundations of voice, acting, and dance.*
  • Blackburn: Discover a hidden piece of NWA history as War Eagle Cavern reopens on Mar 4, unveiling a never-before-seen, 150 yr old carving that could connect the historic cave to War Eagle Mill.
  • New start: Goodwill is expanding its Transitional Employment Opportunity program with two new locations on Dixieland Rd in Rogers, aimed at helping people formerly incarcerated or arrested find work.
  • 📅 What's happening? Check out upcoming events mentioned in the newsletter or post your own HERE!
  • 🚀 Want your message to reach our 25,800+ subscribers? Fill out this form or shoot us an email.

*Content is sponsored
